attributes.action: Give ancient woodland the same protection status as conservation areas.
attributes.additional_details:
We are loosing the last of our ancient to developments
I'm aware of at least 400 ancient woods currently under threat in the UK. I point to the examples of Oaken Wood in Kent, Smithy wood near Sheffield. HS2 will cost us (74 acres) in phase one alone.
Taken from the forestry.gov website: 
Full planning permission for a development automatically provides an exemption for felling trees.
In reality ancient woodland has no legal protection from development and we need to save then before there gone
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest tree cover percentages in the world with only 13% of the UK covered by woodland. Ancient woodland makes for about 2% of the total cover. Give Ancient woodland full legal protection and stop woodlands from been cut down for development of Roads and buildings.
